Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Added null checks to mitigate exceptions on the '/profiles' pages" (#9388) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The `/profiles` pages use the same js script as the search page, but do not have a `searchForm` element on the page, so we were getting exceptions from the javascript on the `/profiles` pages when we tried to reference the form elements.

I've now added checks in the script so that we do not reference anything that doesn't exist on the page.

I also removed a helper method that was not being used by the search page anymore (`AddSortByOption()`).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Tags sometimes spill over into the next line when there are multiple of them" (#9391) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9389

In the search results, tags sometimes spill over into the next line when there are multiple of them, but appear on the same line as downloads, version, etc. when there are very few of them.

Previously:
![a51fdb2a-1c2c-45aa-b1c4-32db778b645d](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218596546-bf541bb9-fd3b-4836-bac2-5d34f710fc97.jpg)

This is a consequence of the search results column now being narrower since the filter panel is on the left of the results rather than being above it.

Now, we will always show tags on the next line so that it is consistent.

After the change:
![5942d32f-fa23-42d5-9042-f543b052b527](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218596542-0d91449b-c104-4cf8-9d98-d4226f7a2272.jpg)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug] 'Template' package type filters combined with Frameworks filters should warn?" (#9390) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
Templates do not have a Frameworks tab on the Package Details page. Should we also disallow/warn users when they try to combine the `packageType = template` filter with frameworks filters? The behaviors across the frameworks tab and frameworks filters should be consistent.

Q: Are target frameworks expected with template packages? Most template packages in our ecosystem do not have target frameworks, but a handful do.

### Solution
Should we also disallow/warn users when they try to combine the `packageType = template` filter with frameworks filters?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug] Tags sometimes spill over into the next line when there are multiple of them" (#9389) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
In the search results, when there are very few tags, they appear on the same line as the downloads, last updated date and version, but spill over into the next line when there are multiple tags. This behavior should be consistent. 

This is a consequence of the search results column now being narrower since the filter panel is on the left of the results rather than being above it. 

### Solution
Possible solution: Always show tags on the next line so that it is consistent.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Search page A11y fixes" (#9387) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
1. This PR fixes an accessibility issue where, when the TFM section was collapsed and there were very few search results on the page, the black text of some of the TFM checkbox labels could overlap with the dark blue footer background (even though the checkboxes were not visible), causing a contrast issue on A11y FastPass. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218198449-23ec3954-7e64-46d7-8347-5df58ac1b18e.png)
We now flip the TFM tab's `display` property between `'none'` and `'block'` when it is collapsed or expanded. This also means we don't need to manually toggle `tabindex` for the checkboxes when the section is collapsed or expanded.

2. The text we show when there's 0 package results also has an a11y issue, where it shouldn't have the `aria-expanded` property. I've removed that now.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/218199365-a21f5d7f-675f-4bd4-8879-6cbbb23fa11a.png)

3. I've also removed an unused ViewModel property (`ShouldDisplayAdvancedSearchPanel`).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Modify warning message on display package page when missing readme" (#9365) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 characters):

* Introduced new warning message on package display page when package is missing readme
* only display warning message to package authors
* added feature flag to this new warning

Before: 
![Screenshot 2023-01-31 140711](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/215915916-076f6854-e2da-48fb-8a73-6a8f8ddf11ed.png)
After: 
![Screenshot 2023-01-31 140647](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64443925/215915939-7573b301-73ad-4108-98c8-5b3a164070df.png)


Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4695

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Simultaneously pushing and unlisting a package may result in incorrect latest" (#7607) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Consider the following:

1. Package is uploaded and unlisted at the same time.
2. Package is added to the database by upload flow.
3. Package is unlisted by unlist flow.
4. After being unlisted, package's IsLatest is updated incorrectly by upload flow, which still thinks package is listed.

Ideally, the unlist flow should not be able to execute until upload flow is completed. Perhaps the upload flow is committing to DB multiple times?

See https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/7536 for more information

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "project.assets.json should not contain username in it" (#12434) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently, dotnet restore --locked generates project.assets.json, which contains the username of whomever ran the command.  This causes issues because every build in our CI loop there is new username (using a GUID), and so the hash of project.assets.json changes and downstream items rebuild.

### Desired Behavior

Username should be removed from project.assets.json.

### Additional Context

In some cases were are able to overwrite the username after nuget restore runs with a common value, but it becomes more tricky which the call to nuget restore is nested (like the build calls npm, which runs some javascript that then calls dotnet restore).

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "[Bug]: Versions_SelectionChanged throws NullReferenceException when changing selected package" (#12184) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

17.5 Preview 1.0 33023.41.main

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

Other

### Repro Steps & Context

I don't see any direct customer impact from this, but when changing selected version, the debugger shows exceptions being thrown from `Versions_SelectionChanged` due to `null` value in the AddedItem[0] element (see https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Xamls/ProjectView.xaml.cs#L279)

1. Attach a debugger.
2. Launch Project PM UI.
3. Change selected packages.
4. Observe the NRE.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/197612110-6c4fde03-4c62-403c-8c38-7a88bd20efc9.png)


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "project.assets.json should not contain username in it" (#12434) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently, dotnet restore --locked generates project.assets.json, which contains the username of whomever ran the command.  This causes issues because every build in our CI loop there is new username (using a GUID), and so the hash of project.assets.json changes and downstream items rebuild.

### Desired Behavior

Username should be removed from project.assets.json.

### Additional Context

In some cases were are able to overwrite the username after nuget restore runs with a common value, but it becomes more tricky which the call to nuget restore is nested (like the build calls npm, which runs some javascript that then calls dotnet restore).

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Add a "do not auto close" label" (#12433) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
fix: https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/2131

Add a "do not auto close" label, and bot will never close them. This only apply to home and Client.Engineering repositories.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The command â€œdotnet listâ€ will not work if a devops source is enabled in the â€œnuget.configâ€ file " (#12394) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

.NET SDK Version: 7.0.102

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps: 
1. Make sure a devops source (e.g. https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/farhub/_packaging/farhub/nuget/v3/index.json) is enabled in the â€œnuget.configâ€ file (path: C:\Users\[UserName]\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config) 
2. Patch dotnet sdk (please refer to [Install and patch the dotnet with the nupkgs](https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/NuGet/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc=%7b8a3c6685-1661-47f4-8807-b765ca62aea1%7d&action=edit&wd=target%28Package%20Signing%20Manual%20Test.one%7C0344a15b-01b1-4828-af4c-63fe53687f8a%2FPatch%20dotnet%20SDK%7Cfd0e3c41-e7a8-4de8-b83a-1a09fdb56271%2F%29&wdorigin=NavigationUrl)) 
3. Create a Powershell script named "Test.ps1" with below contents. **Pleaseâ€¯changeâ€¯theâ€¯valueâ€¯ofâ€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯toâ€¯theâ€¯patchedâ€¯SDK from step2.** 
```
"Getting latest .NET Core CLI"  
#â€¯Plsâ€¯changeâ€¯theâ€¯valueâ€¯ofâ€¯belowâ€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯toâ€¯theâ€¯patchedâ€¯SDK.  
$patchSDKCommandâ€¯=â€¯"C:\Users\v-luzh\Desktop\PatchedSDK\dotnet.exe"â€¯â€¯  
"Testing the following version of the .NET Core CLI/SDK"  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯--version  
"Creating test package projects"  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommand new classlib -n â€¯MyLib  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommand new classlib -n MyDep  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯add MyLib/MyLib.csprojâ€¯referenceâ€¯MyDep/MyDep.csproj  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯newâ€¯slnâ€¯-nâ€¯test  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯slnâ€¯addâ€¯MyLib/MyLib.csproj  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯slnâ€¯addâ€¯MyDep/MyDep.csproj  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯build  
"Creating packages"  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=1.0.1  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=1.0.2  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=1.0.3-beta  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=1.1.0  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=1.2.0-beta  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=2.0.0  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯msbuildâ€¯/t:packâ€¯/p:version=3.0.0-beta  
"Creating nuget.config"  
New-Itemâ€¯.\localSource\â€¯-ItemTypeâ€¯Directoryâ€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯newâ€¯nugetconfig  
$xmlâ€¯=â€¯[xml](Get-Contentâ€¯.\nuget.config)â€¯  
$sourcesâ€¯=â€¯$xml.SelectSingleNode('/configuration/packageSources')  
$sources.RemoveAll()  
$sourceâ€¯=â€¯$xml.CreateElement('add')  
$source.SetAttribute('key',â€¯'localSource')â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
$source.SetAttribute('value',â€¯'localSource')â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
$sources.AppendChild($source)  
$sourceâ€¯=â€¯$xml.CreateElement('add')  
ifâ€¯(Test-Pathâ€¯.\cli\sdk\NuGetFallbackFolder)â€¯{  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯$source.SetAttribute('key',â€¯'dotnetFallbackFolder')â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯$source.SetAttribute('value',â€¯'cli/sdk/NuGetFallbackFolder')â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯$sources.AppendChild($source)  
}  
$configâ€¯=â€¯$xml.CreateElement('config')  
$xml.DocumentElement.AppendChild($config)â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
$globalPackagesFolderâ€¯=â€¯$xml.CreateElement('add')  
$globalPackagesFolder.SetAttribute('key',â€¯'globalPackagesFolder')  
$globalPackagesFolder.SetAttribute('value',â€¯'globalPackages')  
$config.AppendChild($globalPackagesFolder)â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
$xml.Save((Join-Pathâ€¯(Get-Location)â€¯nuget.config))  
Copy-Itemâ€¯*\bin\Debug\*.nupkgâ€¯.\localSource\â€¯|â€¯Out-Null  
"Creating test program"  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯newâ€¯consoleâ€¯-nâ€¯MyProg  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯addâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯MyLibâ€¯-vâ€¯1.0.0  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯restoreâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csproj  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯newâ€¯consoleâ€¯-nâ€¯deprecationTest  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯addâ€¯.\deprecationTest\deprecationTest.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯NuGet.Coreâ€¯-vâ€¯2.14.0  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitiveâ€¯--highest-patch  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 1.0.2"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitiveâ€¯--highest-patchâ€¯--include-prerelease  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 1.0.3-beta"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitiveâ€¯--highest-minor  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 1.1.0"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitiveâ€¯--highest-minorâ€¯--include-prerelease  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 1.2.0-beta"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitive  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 2.0.0"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MyProg\MyProg.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--outdatedâ€¯--include-transitiveâ€¯--include-prerelease  
"latest version of MyLib and MyDep above should be 3.0.0-beta"  
Pause  

&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯.\deprecationTest\deprecationTest.csprojâ€¯packageâ€¯--deprecated  
"the deprecated package version of deprecationTest above should be 2.14.0"  
Pause  

"testing complete with the following version of the .NET Core CLI/SDK"  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯--version  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommand new classlib -n MultiTargetTest 
$xml=@' 
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯<PropertyGroup>  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯<TargetFrameworks>netstandard1.3;netstandard2.0</TargetFrameworks>  
â€¯â€¯â€¯</PropertyGroup>  
â€¯â€¯â€¯<ItemGroup>  
   â€¯<PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.Json" Version="11.0.1" />  
â€¯â€¯â€¯</ItemGroup>  
â€¯â€¯â€¯<ItemGroup Condition="'$(TargetFramework)'â€¯==â€¯'netstandard1.3'">  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯<PackageReference Include="Moq" Version="4.10.0" />  
â€¯â€¯â€¯</ItemGroup>  
â€¯â€¯â€¯<ItemGroup Condition="'$(TargetFramework)'â€¯==â€¯'netstandard2.0'">  
â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯â€¯<PackageReference Include="xunit" Version="2.4.0" />  
â€¯â€¯â€¯</ItemGroup>  
</Project>  
'@  

Out-Fileâ€¯-FilePath .\MultiTargetTest\MultiTargetTest.csproj -InputObject $xml 
&â€¯$patchSDKCommand restore MultiTargetTest\MultiTargetTest.csproj  
&â€¯$patchSDKCommandâ€¯listâ€¯MultiTargetTest\MultiTargetTest.csprojâ€¯package  
"The output above should have two target frameworks, netstandard1.3 and netstandard2.0"  
"Moq should be listed under netstandard1.3, but not netstandard2.0"  
"xunit should be listed under netstandard2.0, but not netstandard1.3"  
"Newtonsoft.Json should be listed under both" 
Pause 
```

4. Open a powershell command window  
  4.1. Open Task Manager. 
  4.2. Navigate on the main menu to File | â€œRun new task.â€ 
  4.3. In the Open textbox type: 
â€¯        Powershell -ExecutionPolicy Bypass 
  4.4. Enable the option â€œCreate this task with administrative privileges.â€ And click the OK button. 
5. Cd to the path of "Test.ps1" and run the script.
#### Expected: 
The command â€œdotnet listâ€ should work if a devops source is enabled in the â€œnuget.configâ€ file. 
#### Actual: 
The command â€œdotnet listâ€ doesnâ€™t work if a devops source is enabled in the â€œnuget.configâ€ file as below.

#### Notes:
1. It doesn't repro when the devops package source is disabled in â€œnuget.configâ€ file. And we always execute the Dotnet List Packages Test in this way.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug Bash] The â€œInstallâ€ button is clickable and package can be installed successfully even if the custom version drop-down box is empty. " (#12395) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.15

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:â€¯â€¯ 

1. Create a C# Console App (.Net core) project.   
2. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packagesâ€¦" menu item to open PM UI.   
3. Click settings button (top-right of right panel), check "Allow format selection on first package install" in General tab and click OK.                                         
4. Go to "Browse" tab and click a package (for example "Newtonsoft.Json").  

5. Click the "Version" drop-down box in the right panel. 

6. Delete the default version from the custom version drop-down box and click â€œInstallâ€ button. 

#### Expected:â€¯â€¯ 

The â€œInstallâ€ button should be unclickable after step 6. 

#### Actual:â€¯â€¯ 

The â€œInstallâ€ button is clickable and package is installed successfully when no version is typed in the custom version drop-down box as below record: 
![custom version](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/215724755-d8134b8d-9298-491f-b19e-e92c1fc57b1d.gif)


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue " [Pack] NU1102 errors occur when running command â€œdotnet pack --runtime win10-x64â€ " (#12427) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.19

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

1. Open VS and create a C# Class Library (.Net Core) project through menu File->New->Project->select the â€œProject Typeâ€ as â€œC#â€->search â€œConsole Appâ€ in the filter.  

2. Click the â€œC# Class Libraryâ€ in the list and click â€œNextâ€ button. 

3. Type project name as â€œPackage1â€ in â€œProject nameâ€ text box and click â€œNextâ€ button. 

4. Select â€œ.NET 7.0â€ in the â€œFrameworkâ€ dropdown box and click â€œCreateâ€ button. 

6. Build solution and make sure compilation succeeds.  

7. Open â€œDeveloper Command Promptâ€, cd to â€œPackage1â€ project path. 

8. Run â€œ`dotnet pack --runtime win10-x64`â€. 

#### Expected:â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

Running the command â€œ`dotnet pack --runtime win10-x64`â€ should be successful. 

#### Actual:â€¯â€¯â€¯ 

NU1102 errors (e.g. â€œNU1102: `Unable to find package Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.Runtime.win-x64 with version (= 7.0.3)`â€) occur when running command â€œ`dotnet pack --runtime win10-x64`â€ as below screenshot. 

![MicrosoftTeams-image (8)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/218045821-99585c20-4708-45a2-a119-911543930cd2.png)

#### Note: 

1.Itâ€™s still repro when configure an additional source [dotnet7](https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_packaging/dotnet7/nuget/v3/index.json)  refer https://github.com/dotnet/installer#installers-and-binaries, the error is as below screenshot: 
![MicrosoftTeams-image (10)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/218046191-78e8104c-e340-4280-a5a3-848df195bd79.png)
2. It's doesn't repro on VS Main\33310.108 + NuGet Client Dev\6.5.0.139. 

#### Verbose Logs
```
Error Log:
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102: Unable to find package Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App.Runtime.win-x64 with version (= 7.0.3)
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 107 version(s) in nuget.org [ Nearest version: 7.0.2 ]
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in C:\Program Files\dotnet\library-packs
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102: Unable to find package Microsoft.AspNetCore.App.Runtime.win-x64 with version (= 7.0.3)
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 110 version(s) in nuget.org [ Nearest version: 7.0.2 ]
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in Microsoft Visual Studio Offline Packages
C:\Users\v-cicili\source\repos\Package1\Package1\package1.csproj : error NU1102:   - Found 0 version(s) in C:\Program Files\dotnet\library-packs
```
